issuetype.name: Improvement

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
h3. I am working on an iOS application with an enterprise license but after deploying the app to our website it doesnâ€™t seem to work

Gives an error that app cannot be downloaded at this time

I have found these types of errors to work with with xcode but with appcelerator this is not the case

When I choose an Adhoc option this seems to work. I suspect this is a proviosioning issue. My ios license is Enterprise though so I am not sure why I need to use the adhoc license?
fields.summary: Deploying with the enterprise ios license ios 9.2

comments.body: Hello, you will need a distribution provisioning profile for both ad hoc and in house distribution. For your case, this is in house distribution. Here is the guide to [distributing iOS app|http://docs.appcelerator.com/platform/latest/#!/guide/Distributing_iOS_apps-section-27595277_DistributingiOSapps-Distributeandinstallyouradhocapplication] in different ways. Could you point out the what seems to be troubling you.  Thanks.

Hi

I have a distribution profile.

When deploying choosing the Adhoc provisioning profile the app can be downloaded but everyone listed on the device list but if I choose a normal enterprise they get an error the app cannot be downloaded at this time and to try later.

Hello, The issue might be with your enterprise iOS license. Can you provide some screenshots of the issue? Please take screenshots of the steps you are following and attach the screenshots to this ticket. Thanks.
